column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2

#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Negros
#Text=Negros is a large island that is part of the Visayas , the island group comprising the central division of the Philippines .
#Text=The Visayas are roughly the central third of the Philippines , so this region is approximately in the center of the whole country .

#Text=The island-region is known for being the main producer of sugar and organic products in the nation , and is home to many beaches and some nature reserves , as well as the tallest peak of the Visayas , the semi-active Kanlaon Volcano .
#Text=In some cities and towns , especially in Bacolod and to the cities north of it , are several historic landmarks , such as ancestral houses once owned by prominent native families .
#Text=In the south of the island is Dumaguete , a hip university city that attracts both locals and foreigners alike .
#Text=Negros is also famous for its several native cultural events , the most popular being the MassKara Festival , which is annually celebrated every October .

#Text=Negros is also known as one of the top culinary destinations of the Philippines because of its regional cuisine , which is famous for delectable desserts and delicacies and various other dishes .
#Text=Provinces
#Text=Negros is split into two provinces , each of which occupies a part of the island and some nearby islets :
#Text=Negros Occidental - the northwestern part , with Bacolod as the provincial capital .
#Text=Negros Oriental - the southeastern part , with Dumaguete as the provincial capital .

#Text=In the Philippine government 's administrative divisions of the nation , the Negros provinces are included in two different regions , with Negros Occidental in Western Visayas ( Region VI ) and Negros Oriental in Central Visayas ( Region VII ) .
#Text=In terms of languages , the two provinces are strongly connected to these adminstrative regions .
#Text=Negros Occidental speaks Hiligaynon/Ilonggo like some other areas of the Western Visayas , while Negros Oriental speaks Cebuano like the rest of the Central Visayas .
#Text=Here in Wikivoyage , we treat Negros as a separate region since everything is on one island with good transport links all over it .
#Text=Cities
#Text=- The most populous city of Negros , known as " The City of Smiles " because of the MassKara Festival celebrated annually in October .
#Text=Also famous for its sweet delicacies and the delicious chicken inasal .
#Text=- A hip university city in the island 's southeastern tip , known as " The City of Gentle People " , largely because of its gentle and welcoming inhabitants .
#Text=-
#Text=Are old mansions your thing ?
#Text=Highly interested in history ?
#Text=This city north of Bacolod has a lot to offer for history buffs .
#Text=Also home to the main airport of Negros Occidental .
#Text=- A coastal city that serves as a drop-off for whale and dolphin watching in the nearby Tañon Strait .
#Text=- The Negros equivalent to Western Visayas ' Boracay , it offers one of the region 's best beaches and nice summer resorts .
#Text=In other words , a Negrense paradise for beach bums .
#Text=-
#Text=A quaint town on the mid-southeastern coast with a nice sandbar surrounded by turquoise waters also frequently enjoyed by beach-loving travellers .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Negros is the fourth-largest island in the Philippines and the second-largest in the Visayas at .
#Text=Both Luzon ( main island of the north ) and Mindanao ( main island of the south ) are much larger in both area and population .

#Text=In terms of area , Negros is about the same size as Samar ( the 3rd-largest ) or Palawan ( the 5th-largest ) , but it has a larger population than either , with 4.4 million inhabitants as of the 2015 census , versus 1.9 million for Samar and 1.1 million for Palawan .
#Text=Among the cities , Bacolod is the most-populous with 562,000 in the city itself and 790,000 in its metropolitan area .
#Text=Dumaguete is second at 131,377 plus suburbs .
#Text=Both serve as capitals of their respective provinces .
#Text=Magellan was the original leader of the first expedition to circle the Earth , but he was killed in battle on Mactan Island in Cebu Province , leaving Elcano in command the rest of the way .
#Text=The leaders had been promised an island each , and Elcano 's heirs were given the hereditary title Margues de Buglas ; " Buglas " is an obsolete name for Negros .
#Text=They later gave the island its present name " Negros " , which is Spanish for " blacks " , after seeing the island 's dark-skinned native inhabitants .
#Text=The name Buglas and the title , however , have survived into the modern era ; the current Margues lives in Silay .
#Text=For centuries , Negros has been an important center of sugar production and one of the country 's most prosperous regions , hence its nickname the " Sugarbowl of the Philippines " .
#Text=Under colonial American administration , it was the only region where local government was fully run by the native Filipinos , rather than by colonial authorities .
#Text=That government was dominated by a few wealthy Negrense families — mostly owners of sugarcane plantations , many with Spanish and/or Chinese ancestral ties .
#Text=Those families are still influential today in different fields .

#Text=Negros is also actively and progressively pursuing the goal of becoming the " Organic Food Bowl of Asia " , thanks to its lush , fertile volcanic soil suitable for organic multi-crop agriculture .

column1: #Text=Get in
#Text=Bacolod and Dumaguete are the main transport hubs ; each has an active airport and a seaport with many ferries .
#Text=See those city articles for details .
#Text=As of 2018 there are no international flights to the island , though Bacolod airport could handle them and Dumaguete is building a new larger which will come into service in the early 2020s .
#Text=The nearest major international airport is Mactan-Cebu International Airport , but one can also reach the island via Manila , Clark or Iloilo airports .
#Text=Get around

#Text=The vivid yellow Ceres buses ( both air-conditioned and non air-conditioned ) go to all of the cities and most towns on the island , and in some areas , jeepney s are also used between cities and towns near each other .

#Text=Transport options within the cities and towns vary ; jeepneys and taxis are common in Bacolod , but in Dumaguete , as well as many of the smaller places throughout Negros , it is all three-wheelers .
#Text=See the city articles for more details .
#Text=Go next

#Text=Cebu Province lies to the east and its central urban area , Metro Cebu , is easily reached by ferry or by plane , or on a bus which will be carried by a Ro-Ro ( roll-on roll-off ) ferry part of the way .
#Text=There are frequent bus departures from either Dumaguete or Bacolod , and some from some smaller cities and towns as well .
#Text=A bit further east is the popular tourist destination of Bohol , reachable by ferry from Dumaguete .
#Text=Panay is to the west , best reached by ferry from Bacolod to Iloilo .
#Text=The highly developed tourist island of Boracay is just off the north coast of Panay , reachable via Kalibo .
#Text=From there , one might continue north to Romblon .
#Text=Small island provinces nearby are Guimaras , which is closer to Iloilo City in Panay and is separated from Negros by a wide strait , and Siquijor , off the southeastern tip of Negros .
#Text=Both can be reached with short ferry rides , Guimaras from Bacolod and Siquijor from Dumaguete .
